newsitem.title: UK: NWE low straight-run fuel oil steady to soft.
newsitem.headline: NWE low straight-run fuel oil steady to soft.

text.p: NWE low suphur straight-run fuel oil was steady to weaker on Friday as crude sagged, traders said.

An Irish player was heard to have sold a North Sea cargo at around $136 fob NWE. A refiner was heard having bought a Zawia cargo from a trader at a cif price of $143, but the delivery port was not known. The market remains well supplied.
High sulphur straight-run supply was seen as average. A low water E-4 cargo seen recently available in the north was also heard on offer in the Med, one Italian player said.
A refiner in Italy was heard to have bought an M-100 cargo from Tuapse at around $2.50 over the quoted low sulphur high cif.
